commandBaseClass.description: The base abstract class for all commands in Hytale's command system. Contains logic for argument registration, subcommands, permissions, and execution.

methods.name: getDisplayName
methods.description: Returns the display name of the command sender

methods.name: getUuid
methods.description: Returns the UUID of the command sender

methods.name: getName
methods.description: Returns the name of the command owner (plugin or server)

methods.name: suggest
methods.signature: void suggest(CommandSender sender, String textAlreadyEntered, int numParametersTyped, SuggestionResult result)

annotationNote: Hytale does NOT use annotations for command registration. Commands are defined by extending AbstractCommand or its subclasses (CommandBase, AbstractPlayerCommand, etc.) and registered programmatically via CommandManager.registerSystemCommand() or CommandRegistry.registerCommand().

baseClass.name: Argument

argumentTypeClass.name: ArgumentType

methods.name: parse
methods.description: Parses the string input into the data type

methods.name: suggest
methods.signature: void suggest(CommandSender sender, String textAlreadyEntered, int numParametersTyped, SuggestionResult result)

methods.name: getNumberOfParameters
methods.description: Returns the number of string parameters this type consumes

argumentTypes.name: RequiredArg
argumentTypes.description: A required positional argument that must be provided

argumentTypes.name: OptionalArg
argumentTypes.description: An optional named argument specified with --name=value syntax

argumentTypes.name: DefaultArg
argumentTypes.description: An optional argument with a default value if not provided

argumentTypes.name: FlagArg
argumentTypes.description: A boolean flag argument (--flag syntax, defaults to false)

argumentTypes.name: SingleArgumentType
argumentTypes.codeSnippet:
public abstract class SingleArgumentType<DataType> extends ArgumentType<DataType> {
   protected SingleArgumentType(Message name, @Nonnull String argumentUsage, @Nullable String... examples)
argumentTypes.description: Base class for argument types that consume a single parameter

argumentTypes.name: MultiArgumentType
argumentTypes.description: Base class for argument types that consume multiple parameters

argumentTypes.name: ListArgumentType
argumentTypes.description: Wraps another argument type to accept lists via [item1,item2,...] syntax

argumentTypes.name: EnumArgumentType
argumentTypes.description: Argument type for Java enum values with auto-completion

argumentTypes.name: AssetArgumentType
argumentTypes.description: Argument type for Hytale asset references (items, entities, etc.)

argumentTypes.name: GameModeArgumentType
argumentTypes.description: Argument type for Hytale GameMode enum values

relativeTypes.name: RelativeVector3i
relativeTypes.description: 3D integer vector with relative coordinate support

relativeTypes.name: RelativeDoublePosition
relativeTypes.description: 3D double position with relative coordinate support

argumentSystem.commonArgTypes: ArgTypes static class provides common argument types: STRING, INTEGER, FLOAT, DOUBLE, BOOLEAN, PLAYER_REF, ITEM_ASSET, GAME_MODE, and more (ArgTypes.java failed to decompile due to complexity)

managerClass.name: CommandManager

registerMethods.name: registerSystemCommand
registerMethods.description: Registers a system command owned by the server

registerMethods.name: register
registerMethods.description: Core registration method that adds command to registry and processes aliases

pluginRegistration.name: CommandRegistry
pluginRegistration.description: Plugin-specific command registry that assigns plugin ownership to commands

handleCommand.signature: public CompletableFuture<Void> handleCommand(@Nonnull CommandSender commandSender, @Nonnull String commandString)
handleCommand.description: Handles command execution asynchronously via ForkJoinPool

executeMethod.signature: protected abstract CompletableFuture<Void> execute(@Nonnull CommandContext context)
executeMethod.description: Abstract method that subclasses implement to execute the command logic

commandContext.name: CommandContext
commandContext.description: Contains the execution context: sender, parsed arguments, and input string

tabCompletion.mechanism: Tab completion is provided through the SuggestionProvider interface. ArgumentType extends SuggestionProvider and can override suggest(). Individual arguments can also have custom SuggestionProviders attached via the suggest() method. SuggestionResult collects suggestions and supports fuzzy matching.

suggestionResult.description: Collects suggestions with support for fuzzy matching up to 5 results

tokenizerClass.name: Tokenizer
tokenizerClass.description: Parses command input into tokens. Supports quoted strings (single/double), list arguments ([a,b,c]), and escape sequences (\, \', \", \[, \], \,)

commandHierarchy.name: AbstractCommand
commandHierarchy.description: Base abstract class with all command logic

commandHierarchy.name: AbstractAsyncCommand
commandHierarchy.description: Base for async commands with error handling

commandHierarchy.name: AbstractPlayerCommand
commandHierarchy.description: Commands that require the sender to be a player

commandHierarchy.name: AbstractWorldCommand
commandHierarchy.description: Commands that operate on a world context

builtinCommands.name: give
builtinCommands.description: Gives items to the executing player. Has a variant for giving to other players.

builtinCommands.name: gamemode
builtinCommands.description: Changes the player's game mode (Adventure, Creative, etc.)

builtinCommands.name: kill
builtinCommands.description: Kills the executing player. Has a variant for killing other players.

builtinCommands.name: kick
builtinCommands.description: Kicks a player from the server

builtinCommands.name: stop
builtinCommands.description: Stops the server. Optional --crash flag forces crash shutdown.

builtinCommands.name: help
builtinCommands.description: Opens help UI for commands. Can specify a specific command to view.

builtinCommands.name: sudo
builtinCommands.description: Executes a command as another player. Supports * for all players.

builtinCommands.name: whereami
builtinCommands.description: Shows player's location info: world, chunk, position, rotation, direction

builtinCommands.name: entity
builtinCommands.description: Command collection for entity management (clone, remove, dump, etc.)

builtinCommands.name: worldmap
builtinCommands.description: Command collection for world map operations (discover, undiscover, markers, view radius)

permissionSystem.howPermissionsWork: Permissions are string-based following the format 'namespace.category.action'. Commands auto-generate permissions based on their hierarchy (e.g., 'hytale.command.give.self'). Permissions can be set explicitly via requirePermission() or generated from parent command's permission. The CommandSender interface extends PermissionHolder which provides hasPermission() checks.

hytalePermissions.description: Static helper class for creating Hytale-namespaced permissions

permissionSystem.permissionGroups: Commands can be assigned to permission groups via setPermissionGroup(GameMode). This creates virtual permission groups (e.g., Adventure, Creative) that bundle related permissions.

subcommands.description: Commands can have subcommands added via addSubCommand(). Subcommands inherit the parent's permission prefix.
subcommands.example: EntityCommand adds 16 subcommands like EntityCloneCommand, EntityRemoveCommand

usageVariants.description: Commands can have usage variants via addUsageVariant() for different argument counts (e.g., /kill vs /kill <player>). Variants must have different numbers of required parameters.
usageVariants.example: KillCommand has a variant KillOtherCommand that takes a player argument

aliases.description: Commands can have aliases via addAliases(). Aliases are case-insensitive.
aliases.example: stop has alias 'shutdown', gamemode has alias 'gm', help has alias '?'

confirmation.description: Commands can require --confirm flag via the requiresConfirmation constructor parameter. This adds a FlagArg automatically.

extraArguments.description: Commands can allow extra arguments beyond defined ones via setAllowsExtraArguments(true). Used by sudo command.

argumentDependencies.description: Optional arguments can have dependencies: requiredIf(), requiredIfAbsent(), availableOnlyIfAll(), availableOnlyIfAllAbsent()
